Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Laura C
Reviews.Content: I went to Venice in the middle of Carnival and it was amazing! Regarding the hotel, we only stayed there one night and left really early in the morning. The room was spacious and clean: it had everything we needed. The hotel itself is an ancient big house, very beautiful, but it really doesn't have elevators. The street market happened when we where there, but it ended 11 pm and didn't disturb us. The location is good, near the train station. If you don't like to walk (we walked all over), you can take the alilaguna (a boat that functions as a bus). Finally, the staff was really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location was the only plus point”
Reviews.Author: OdeToJoy-SG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located quite near to the train station, less than 10 minutes walk, but far from main attractions. My husband and I got a street facing room , thus it was very noisy at night and even early in the morning (like 3 , 4 am) as the stall holders are setting up their stalls. The hotel is very old and to get to the reception and rooms, you need to walk up the stairs (which is very inconvenient if you have large N heavy luggAges). The room is clean but many things in the room were not working ( windows were spoilt, heater not working, sAtellite TV not working, nothing to hold your clothes and towels in the toilet) . Although there is a fan in the room, we cannot really use it as it was really dusty. The hotel staff is not very friendly , I requested for help with the luggages but they asked me to do it myself. Worst hotel experience in Italy so far.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: nomads5
Reviews.Content: we were here in September and found the location to be pretty good, easy walk to the main parts of Venice and all restaurants. We were Eurailing around Europe with our three children and walked from the train station and it only took 15 minutes. We had a family room which was quite big however, a bit wierd having the actual toilet in the shower. In the warmer months it's a bit noisy in the front room as there are markets outside the window that close late and open early. But the price was right, the location was good and the staff friendly. For a family this is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality and simplicity par excellence”
Reviews.Author: KYSINGH
Reviews.Content: We, my two teenage children, wife and self, visited Arcadia Hotel this month. We reached late because we flew into Roma and then caught the Eurostar to Venice. We were shown to our room overlooking the fruit stalls and market. The bedsheets were of excellent quality, soft and clean and of brilliant good cotton. The bathroom was big size only hitch was the shower and the pot were too close. The bath towels were also of superior quality. The breakfast in the morning was wholesome and good. The coffee machine dotted out lots of variations. The staff was most helpful and kind. We bumped into the young handsome owner Fredricko, who gave us lots of tips, shopping and the high end fashions on great discounts. Also gave great tips for Firenze and Roma. Then sent us on a trip to Murano free arranging a water taxi. Fredricko was extremely good. Love our stay of 3-4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Basic needs covered in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: frrala
Reviews.Content: Very good budget option. Stayed for a week in Sept 2009. Location perfect for both transfer from/to airport and exploring Venice on foot/by boat. Rooms basic and a bit dated, but spotlessly clean and fresh towels provided daily. Continental breakfast (wonderful coffee!) served by corteous and smiling staff in a spectacular room. Modest breakfast choices can be easily supplemented from fruit stalls located directly in front of the hotel (we were forced to reluctantly admire the stallholders work ethics as they started assembling before 6 a.m.), there's also a lot of local cafes and grocery shops in vicinity. You are always welcomed by a pleasant smile at the reception. It's also worth exploring restaurants and bars by the canals behind the hotel and the Ghetto.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay in Italy”
Reviews.Author: cjones0926
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and tried to avoid it as much as possible. Our first night we had no baby cot as was requested. I showed my receeipt to prove we requested one and they still continued to argue. Finalyl my husband went and talked to them and they managed to get us one...but it was broke so there was no way we were using it. The room was disgusting. Our room only had a shower and it had mold everywhere so it was hard for me to give my 18 month old a shower considering we usually sit with her. It was very hot, and no way to cool it down. The bed was actually comfortable though, just too many blankets. Yiou could hear EVERYTHING. The room we had must have been where the main water flowed because everytime someone flushed or took a shower, the room got very loud.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Cheap Hotel in Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: chole110
Reviews.Content: As others have said before this is a great hotel if you're looking for a bargin in a good location. Do not stay here if you are expecting the latest mod cons - it's basic and is ideal for those rating comfort and good value above all else. It's in a great location. Very close to SL Train station which is ideal when you arrive late at night by train and have to drag your case to the hotel. It was very very easy to find. From there it's then easy to get round Venice from Arcadia. There is a water bus station nearby or you can easily walk to S Marco which I would highly recommend. On our second day we decided to go for a stroll along the Grand Canal, ended up wandering down some lovely little alleys and before we knew it we were back at our hotel. It was a very enjoyable and beautiful walk. The hotel is open 24 hours so very convenient. I should imagine that the bedrooms would get very hot in Summer as there is no air con and only a fan in the rooms. We were there in September and with the temperatures at around 28 - 30 degrees it was bearable - any hotter and you could find it a bit uncomfortable. The rooms were basic but spacious. The bed was a little tatty but comfortable and clean. The bathroom was a good size and clean. The hotel wasn't too noisy at night, we had a room just down from Reception and it was a bit loud when the phone rang or when people arrived - but this didn't really trouble us during the night. Best part of the hotel has to be the breakfast room. It was amazing. Beautiful Venetian room and to top it off probably the best breakfast we had in Italy. It was a help yourself buffet of cereal, coffee, croissants and breads/jams etc and as you could take as much as you liked we found it filled us up for the day. Would really recommend this hotel for anyone looking to do Venice on a budget

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: loakes
Reviews.Content: Given that the train station is on the other side of the city from San Marco (the heart of the action) your hotel is either going to be near one or the other, so you need to make your choices. This hotel is near the station, which is great when you are dragging cases around, and it is also near the water bus stop so it's handy for getting round the city by boat. The room is certainly big enough and perfectly adequate with a good bathroom. The hotel is clean and although it doesn't have aircon, we found the fan in the room was absolutely fine - and Venice was really stinking hot when we were there. The breakfast is typical continental style with breads and yogurts etc, but more than adequate to start the day, and served in an absolutely beautiful breakfast room, really reminiscent of old Venice. There is 24 reception staff and we found everyone to be very helpful and friendly. The Canaregio area is nice, especially the Jewish quarter which is interesting, but it's a good 40-45 minute walk from the hotel to San Marco. Given the ridiculous prices in Venice, we felt this hotel was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden venetian comfort - if you're after luxury go elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Lals_79
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for luxury then this hotel is probably not for you. Although it offers basic amenities we found it comfortable and well positioned in Cannareggio. The hotel offers a good size bedroom and bathroom, small TV and an electric fan (which was faulty but worked by wedging a piece of cardboard in the on button). Breakfast is included which is basic but still enough to be satisfied. The location is good. It is on a main road, surrounded by restaurants, shops, fresh fruit/veg market and a gelateria opposite it. It is also conveniently located at 10mins walk to the St Lucia train station. A 45min leisurely walk will get you to St Mark's square and the walk is worth it as you see just how beautiful Venice really is! A 30 min walk will get you to the Rialto bridge. Although this is not a luxurious hotel, we enjoyed staying there nonetheless as it's decor' is venetian and quite romantic and characteristic.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your money here”
Reviews.Author: JackieMack
Reviews.Content: Staff were rude. Location was good, but it was noisy. Building is very old and therefore the doors on the bathroom dont shut properly as well as the windows and balcony door no longer shut to lock up either. We had a street room which was good by day, but noisy by night. In desperate need of a renovation or demolition. The worse hotel I stayed in in my 4 weeks of travelling with the family. Only stayed there 2 nights and that was 2 nights too many. Put your money towards a room with air conditioning elsewhere. The Arcadia has no Air con.

Reviews.Title: “impressive building, bathroom substandard, no aircon”
Reviews.Author: charleybeee
Reviews.Content: The hotel doesn't look like much from the outside, but once inside, the building is quite grand and impressive. This is a bit misleading though because the room itself was a bit of a let-down. The bathroom was shabby and a bit dirty, metal was rusted and surfaces stained etc. The bedroom too was a bit grubby. The fabric bed head was stained where other guests' heads had been and I had to put a towel over it before I could sleep. The sheets and towels were clean though. The main drawback of the rooms however was the lack of air conditioning. We spent two nights in mid July. We were provided with a fan, which was ineffectual and noisy. On the plus-side however the staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Try some other hotel in summer”
Reviews.Author: raayab
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just 5 minutes from Railway station and close to Giglio (2 minutes) and S. Marcuola (5 minutes). Thats the only good thing about it. Otherwise, in summer it is very hot (no air conditions or ceiling fans, just a small pedestal fan). Mosquitoes can be another big problem. You would prefer to do breakfast outside, because in the hotel it was quite bad. Some staff was good, others were not that polite.

Reviews.Title: “It has a touch of old Venice”
Reviews.Author: Adalbert12
Reviews.Content: We stayed for nine days. It was very good choice. Location of the hotel itself is great, very easy to find. Rare thing in Venice. Yes, the main street is a little bit noisy, but its within limits. On the other hand to find some Osteria for dinner is matter of seconds. Hotel itself does not run restaurant, but next to entry is a solid pizzeria. Breakfast room is very nice, spacey and beautifully decorated. Breakfast itself was rather simple, continental only, with some flakes. Coffee was great. Funny thing was, they charged for water. No tap water available, just bottled for 1 â‚¬, if I remember correctly. Room itself (we had street window) was simple, as big/small as expected. Bathroom with a tube was quite big and always clean. No separate toilet. Service was always very friendly, speaking couple of languages inclusive English. They did offered wireless internet, but for 12â‚¬ per 24 hours. They just re-sell that service. This hotel is great value for money. Its great spot for every budget traveller and still delivering great service.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: anica_ro2005
Reviews.Content: I was there in February for Carnival. The room was very spacious, comfortable, clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Alenchik
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at Hotel Arcadia. The room was unremarkable and on the small side, but perfectly clean with a nice bathroom. The breakfast room, on the other hand, was beoynd lovely, with amazing ceiling and chandeliers. It was a pleasure starting our day there. The location is very convenient, on one of the main streets with many restaurants, shops, etc. The nearest Vaporetto stop was only a minute or two away, and the train station is also conveniently close.

Reviews.Title: “The guy on 24 hour reception duty deserves a medal!”
Reviews.Author: Euro_travellers09
Reviews.Content: This place is one of my favorites on our whole European trip. Reason being, we had to check out at 3am as we (thought) we had a train to catch at 3.45am â€“ however we missed the train and had to go trudging back to the hotel to beg the guy on the 24 hour reception who was sleeping to let us back in and stay in our room for a few more hours as it was the middle of winter and FREEZING outside! They were kind enough to oblige and even let us have breakfast that morning. Speaking of breakfast, the breakfast room is absolutely breathtaking. A big grand old chandelier and lots of olive green Venetian charm make up the dÃ©cor of the room, and the cold buffet is varying and quite nice too. The room itself was HUGE, the bathroom almost the same size as the room itself, and both were very clean, and though very old they were well-maintained. There is a little TV with Cable channels though they are all in Italian apart from the odd film-clip or special on MTV. The hotel is located just a 5 minute walk from the train station and has a fruit market right outside the front door set up each morning. It is in the central shopping hub on that side of the canal, though do make sure you walk to the other side where Piazza San Marco and the Rialto Bridge and designer stores are too â€“ we didnâ€™t know they existed til the last day of our trip and were kicking ourselves for not figuring it out sooner! Overall, a wonderful hotel to stay in if you are on a budget. Clean, comfy, EXCELLENT service and a great location and Venetian appearance.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and cheap”
Reviews.Author: dmktn
Reviews.Content: DÃ©cor Beautiful old Venetian building with huge chandelier, breakfast in a grand wooden room. Styled dÃ©cor in the bedrooms, big Italian wood everywhere. Not the cleanest, but had that certain Venetian charm. Mini balcony facing rear garden and fan in the room tried to keep it cool, despite the triple hot August weather. Price Around Â£50 for a double room, it was pretty much the cheapest double in Venice. Location Excellent location, 5 min walk from the train station in an area that is not sleazy at all despite what we read. Loads of cafes/bars/restaurants around, not too touristy, fruit an veg market bang in front of it. Extras Delicious Breakfast, would stay again, but maybe when the weather is cooler. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: dinotour
Reviews.Content: The room was dark and damp. There were 2 tiny single beds with plastic covered foam mattresses. The shower was tiny and stank. Described as a palace...thats a joke and the only atmospheric thing about the building was the stroppy staff. Breakfast forget it. Every morning we were there the place was full so we did not get to eat. Ideal if you are a student but quite honestly if you are over 21 forget it. This place is more a crash pad than a hotel yet not as cheap. Thank God staying in this place was not my first experience of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Bellisimo Venezia”
Reviews.Author: Racki
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I decided to experience the City of Venice for the first time. We flew with Easyjet to Marco Polo Airport very late in the evening. We bought our tickets for the shuttle bus (3 Euros single or 5.50 Euros return) which are every 20minutes from the airport to Piazzalle Roma (the trip took 20 mins also). Upon arriving in the main bus station, we headed for the water buses ticket office. The water buses run from around 6am to midnight, and tickets were: 6.50 Euros for a single trip, 16 Euros for 24hr use, 21 Euros for 36hr use, etc). Either the No1 or No82 water buses took us to the San Marcolo stop. Even though it was 11.30pm it was very warm. The streets were easy to find & the hotel was just a 5min walk from the water bus stop. The streets were empty, but it didn't feel scary. The hotel reception is open 24hrs, the keys were waiting for us (ask for a safe key at reception free of charge). The room had a double bed & a single bed in it, there was plenty of room to walk around in the room too & an ensuite bathroom (shower only). There was no air conditioning & as it was so hot we were so glad of the fan in the room. It was very clean. The breakfast was continental, hot pasteries, cereal, yogurts, rolls, tea & coffee. A market was right outside the hotel selling fruit & vegetables. We explored the area before hitting the Grand Canal & it was so beautiful. I will leave you to explore the fasinating city of Venice & you will not be dissappointed. The Murano water bus also left from around the corner of the hotel at the Guglie stop. Staff in the hotel were very friendly. Excellent value for the price & it was great to be staying in the lagoon rather than on the outskirts of Venice. Hope you enjoy it as much as we did. xx

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: KNYCK
Reviews.Content: This place is located on a street with a market set up every morning right in front of you! it is great to wake up and open your window to a buzzing street with the canals running alongside. I would highly recommend this hotel not only because the prices are so great for such an expensive city, but there is an incredibly good, nice restaurant across the street called La Piazzini. The breakfast was very nice in the morning and the building itself is quite nice upstairs. Our rooms were superb and the bathrooms were bigger than we had experienced in Florence and Rome. This was my favorite hotel and I would highly recommend this to anyone traveling to Italy on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Nice week”
Reviews.Author: LittleBoy
Reviews.Content: We spent here 5 days. A room was very nice, large and very beatiful. We were pleasant of our bathroom. A staff were very friendly. The breakfast is (only) continental - very good (a fresh croissant), but I prefer ham and eggs. The prize is good. Location is very good. I really recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “best price, best location but nonquality”
Reviews.Author: minnyn
Reviews.Content: Arcadia has a great location, just walking distance to station, vaporettos and Rialto. Hotel's best part is being in the centre. But the rooms are small, the bathroom is ramshackle and the breakfast is so so weak. In the breakfast you just find croissant (with marmelade or sugar), different kind of juice, corn flakes. No bread, no cheese or else.. Just a kind of dessert which is not delicious. In fact the breakfast room is old but nice. You think you eat your meal in a very old palace. Our room was looking to backside and actually we were a little uncomfortable; it makes you feel that you will welcome a steal action suddenly. But no negative comment for staff who was nice.

Reviews.Title: “OK For The Price”
Reviews.Author: PR_Travelers
Reviews.Content: As far as budget Italian hotels go....this one was nice. The room and bathroom were both large and clean. However in the bathroom, the bathtub/shower did not have a curtain so that water got all over the floor. Just remember not to have anything in the bathroom that you don't want to get wet. The hotel is located near the train station. We were able to walk to it in about 10 minutes with all of our luggage. There is no elevator so you have carry your luggage up the stairs. There are restaurants and stores located near the hotel and you can either walk to the attractions or take the expensive and crowded "water" bus. There are lots of people in Venice during the day but it gets very quiet early in the evening. It is a great place but only spend a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “Definite recommend!”
Reviews.Author: goodlookinout
Reviews.Content: This was the cheapest place we found for what we wanted in Venice, and it was excellent. They even moved us to a much nicer/bigger room for the same cost as the original one. The staff are very nice and helpful and it is in a great location. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, bustling hotel...”
Reviews.Author: cymry
Reviews.Content: This charming little hotel is located an easy walk from the train station, on a major street bustling with activity. there's a constant buzz of people coming and going outside, with a laundromat, fruit & vegetable market, internet point, bancomat, and several gelato shops and restaurants right across the street. the hotel has an old-world feel, which was a nice change from generic, world-wide-style hotels. it is a small hotel, and not terribly soundproofed. there is also a restaurant right downstairs, which can be quite noisy as they close up for the night in the wee hours of the morning. a good pair of earplug is recommended if you're a light sleeper. that said, it's enchanting to watch people go by your window, to eat breakfast in the small, tasteful dining room (fresh croissants from a local pastry shop!), and everything is easily traveled. the staff were friendly, but when asked about the free trip to Murano, were evasive and uncooperative. overall, a nice little place.

HotelInfo.Name: Arcadia Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio, 1333/d | Rio Tera San Leonardo, 30121 Venice, Italy
